result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant refused to sign signature bond - went to prison
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Case Called: 3:44 pm
INCLUDES 22CM582 & 22CM583.

State appears by ADA Cody Marschall in person. Defendant appears in custody, in person, and with Atty Vanessa Avila in person.
VRCW.
Plea Questionnaire filed. State moves to:

Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>DRI.

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
22CM582:
Ct. 1 (Disorderly Conduct-Repeater)>> NO CONTEST.

22CM583:
Ct. 1 (Resisting an Officer-Repeater)>> NO CONTEST.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
22CM582:
Ct. 1 (Disorderly Conduct-Repeater)>> 30 Days MCJ, Concurrent to each other and any other sentence currently being served. Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Court finds 30 Days Credit.

22CM583:
Ct. 1 (Resisting an Officer-Repeater)>>  30 Days MCJ, Concurrent to each other and any other sentence currently being served. Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Court finds 30 Days Credit.

DATES CONTINUED
